title: Reason Meghan Markle and Prince Harry unlikely to spend Christmas in the UK explained
description: There's ongoing speculation over whether Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will reunite with the Royal Family, including his father, King Charles III, over the Christmas period

title: Israel says tunnel found under Gaza hospital as hostage deal hopes grow
description: The latest IDF footage from al-Shifa comes as Hamas officials say 13,000 people have now been killed in the Palestinian enclave.

title: ITV I'm A Celebrity's Nigel Farage's huge net worth as bosses infuriate fans with fee payout
description: Former politician Nigel Farage, 59, is reportedly being paid a record-breaking fee of over £1.5million for his stint on ITV's I'm A Celebrity

title: How The Crown handles the conspiracies around Diana’s death
description: The latest season has been heavily criticised for misframing Diana's death – but what is truth and what is fiction?

title: The road to independence is even harder than in 2014
description: Scotland would also have retained the pound, as per the 2013 independence white paper. We would not have had to set up a central bank and an independent currency, still less adopt the much-maligned euro,

title: A return to the scene of a big political stink
description: Ministerial changes | Global hunger | Great Snoring

title: New Rwanda treaty seems unlikely to be ratified before new year
description: Rishi Sunak’s new deal aimed at getting his asylum policy off the ground is not believed to be coming before Wednesday’s autumn statement.

title: My brother the political prisoner, by Sanaa Seif
description: I was just his little sister, now I’m trying to free him from an Egyptian prison. By Sanaa Seif

title: EXCLUSIVE: Nigel Farage's secret French politician girlfriend Laure Ferrari WON'T travel to Australia to meet him when he leaves the Jungle
description: Nigel Farage has a secret girlfriend but she will not be waiting to embrace him as he walks off the infamous I'm A Celebrity bridge, the Daily Mail can reveal.

title: Autumn Statement: Hunt does not rule out income tax cuts
description: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt has not ruled out cutting income tax in Wednesday's Autumn Statement, as he insisted economic growth was his priority. Mr Hunt is finalising the government's spending plans and he seeks to revive a stagnant British economy.

title: Britain’s autumn statement is no time for short-termism
description: The UK needs a disciplined statement that sets out a plan to lift its long-term growth potential. Yet with an election looming, the government also faces short-term political pressures. How Hunt balances these conflicting priorities will determine whether the chancellor’s midweek speech is a boost or a restraint for the British economy.

title: Hunt backs Sunak to solve ‘fearsomely complex’ challenges on Rwanda asylum plan
description: Jeremy Hunt has backed Rishi Sunak to solve the “fearsomely complex” challenge of getting the Rwanda asylum policy to work after it was deemed unlawful by the Supreme Court. The Chancellor said the Government does not want to leave the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) despite calls from the right of the Tory Party.

title: Hunt does not rule out tax cuts in Autumn Statement
description: This breaking news story is being updated and more details will be published shortly. Please refresh the page for the fullest version.

title: Brits in line for ‘important’ tax cut as Jeremy Hunt finally takes axe to sky-high levies
description: JEREMY Hunt is considering handing white van men a tax cut next week – as he finally takes the axe to our sky-high levies. The Chancellor is poised to declare that now inflation is falling

title: Gym owner Andreas Michli stands as London mayoral candidate
description: Health and fitness entrepreneur Andreas Michli has announced his candidacy for the 2024 London mayoral elections. The independent candidate says he was driven to run in the election after he was "radicalised by lockdown". Mr Michli was fined for attempting to keep his north London gym open during lockdown, but this was overturned in court.

title: Inside I’m A Celeb star Nigel Farage’s rollercoaster life as he survives PLANE crash, ‘extreme’ death threats and cancer
description: NIGEL Farage has had a colourful life in and out of politics – and that’s set to continue with his spot on I’m A Celebrity. The former UKIP leader, 59, has been confirmed as part

title: Iain Dale: ‘I sold Princess Di’s Audi for £23k. The next owner sold it for £1m’
description: In late 1989, I was offered a job as PR manager with the Port of Tilbury. If I had accepted, I would have been one of the key people in the privatisation process and presumably made a seven-figure sum in a management buyout, as the other investors did.

title: MAIL ON SUNDAY COMMENT: A farce that proves our broken asylum system is in dire need of reform
description: COMMENT: Any fair-minded, decent person will be enraged by the insulting, grotesque parody of justice which allowed a convicted rapist to remain in this country.

title: 7 politicians who appeared on reality TV — and our expert’s verdict
description: As Nigel Farage heads to the jungle as part of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out of Here! we look at other politicians who have taken the reality TV leap

title: ‘Ill-timed tax breaks would benefit wealthy Scots and harm public services,’ Chancellor told
description: Scotland’s Finance Secretary has urged the Chancellor to avoid “ill-timed tax breaks” in Wednesday’s Autumn Statement that she said would benefit the wealthy but exert more pressure on public services.

title: First British person to walk on the moon by 2025, Nasa predicts
description: A British astronaut could walk on the Moon for the first time by 2025, Nasa officials have told the UK Government. The space agency told Michelle Donelan, the Science Secretary, it was “incredibly possible” that a British person could be on the Artemis III mission – the first time that humans will walk on the Moon’s surface in more than 50 years.

title: Met Office verdict on exact date snow to hit UK before end of November in cold snap
description: Weather maps from WXCharts predict that a snow front is due to arrive in the UK on Sunday November 26 which will stretch down from Scotland to the borders and northern parts of England

title: Is Rishi Sunak’s Rwanda plan finally dead, or merely resting?
description: The PM is desperately trying to save his deportation policy after this week’s devasting Supreme Court decision. Adam Forrest asks whether there is a clever way around the judges’ ruling

title: Joe Manchin inches even closer to third-party presidential run as he blasts Donald Trump and Joe Biden for 'visceral hatred'
description: Sen. Joe Manchin (D-W.V.) made one of his biggest signs that he will make a third-party presidential bid on Sunday when claiming he's seeking to 'mobilize the radical middle.'

title: Jailed Russian nationalist Girkin warns of 'sham' presidential election
description: MOSCOW (Reuters) -Pro-war Russian nationalist Igor Girkin, who is in custody awaiting trial for inciting extremism, said on Sunday he wanted to run for president even though he understood the March election would be "sham" with the winner already clear.

title: Winter pressure may hit NHS Wales wait targets - minister
description: Wales' health minister says she is hopeful winter pressures will not hit targets to bring down waiting lists. However, Eluned Morgan said she would not guarantee that this year's winter pressures would not further jeopardise the targets. The minister conceded that it would be "it will be really tough and it does depend on what happens this winter".

title: Israel-Gaza: Protests against MPs cross a line, says Rachel Reeves
description: Some of the protests targeting MPs over the Israel-Gaza war are "crossing the line" into intimidation, the shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves has said. She made the comments after a demonstration was held in north London on Saturday close to Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer's constituency office.

title: Hunt refuses to rule out shock income tax cut amid warnings of revolt if budget favours rich
description: Jeremy Hunt has warned of backlash from Tory MPs and voters in the “red wall” north and Midlands if he used the autumn statement to offer tax cuts for the rich.

title: Autumn Statement: Homes close to new pylons to get £1,000 off bills
description: Households living close to new pylons and electricity substations could receive up to £1,000 a year off energy bills for a decade under new plans. It is hoped the plan would convince people to support upgrades in their area, which are needed in part for new electric vehicle charging points.

title: UK's Hunt says won't implement tax cuts that fuel inflation
description: British Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt said on Sunday that he would not implement tax cuts that would push up inflation.

title: Chancellor plans to take £1k off annual energy bills for those near new pylons
description: Jeremy Hunt will unveil plan in his Autumn Statement, as part of drive to slash time taken to deliver infrastructure

title: The tax move that could spare the Tories a crushing defeat
description: The UK hasn’t yet licked inflation. Yes, the headline annual figure, as measured by the consumer prices index, dropped to 4.6pc in October, sharply down from 6.7pc the previous month.

title: Argentines vote in election that could lead Trump-admiring populist to the presidency
description: Voters in Argentina head to the polls Sunday in a presidential runoff election that will determine whether South America’s second-largest economy will take a rightward shift. Populist Javier Milei, an upstart candidate who got his start as a television talking head,

title: Cricket World Cup 2023 Final Livestream: How to Watch India vs. Australia From Anywhere
description: India take on Australia in the 2023 Cricket World Cup final at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, India, on Sunday, Nov. 19. Play is set to start at 2 p.m. IST local time in India. (That's 8:30 a.m. GMT in the UK, 7:30 p.m. AEDT in Australia, and 3:30 a.m. ET or 12:30 a.m. PT in the US.)

title: Michael Matheson must go — keeping him will harm politics
description: A s Scottish government ministers go, Michael Matheson has a reputation as one of the more able. He’s certainly among the most experienced in Humza Yousaf’s novice cabinet. An
